title: Personal data protection strategies in e-learning environments

context.prior_knowledge: Experience using basic online learning tools
context.additional_context: Focuses on recognizing data protection issues that may arise when using e-learning platforms in offline classroom settings utilizing digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three types of personal data collected in e-learning environments and their potential risks.
Learners can apply and explain privacy-by-design principles (e.g., data minimization, access control) to real educational scenarios.
Learners can develop step-by-step procedures for creating data protection policies in e-learning systems based on literature review findings.

resources: Personal Information Processing Consent Form Samples

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
